definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: The problem is that it is easily misapplied.
sentences.chinese: 問題是它很容易被誤用。

sentences.english: To avoid misusage of your phone, please take safety measure, such as.
sentences.chinese: 爲了使您的手機免受誤用，請採取防範措施，如。

sentences.english: The concept of intelligence has continued to evolve, despite problems with and misuses of IQ testing.
sentences.chinese: 情報的概念不斷髮展，儘管問題和誤用智商測試。

sentences.english: There are no unspiritual abilities, just misused ones.
sentences.chinese: 從來沒有不屬靈的恩賜，只有被誤用的恩賜。

sentences.english: The potential for misuse of Workspaces is also covered.
sentences.chinese: 文中還涉及到了工作區潛在發生的誤用方式。

sentences.english: To avoid misusage of your phone , please take safety measure, such as.
sentences.chinese: 爲使您的手機免受誤用，請採取防範措施，如。

sentences.english: I noticed a misuse of the word “who” in your letter.
sentences.chinese: 我發現在你的信中誤用了who這個詞。

sentences.english: In my opinion, the problem is misusing the authority and using it unnecessarily.
sentences.chinese: 問題在於誤用權威和在不必要的時候使用權威。

sentences.english: More often than not, I find this attribute misused or misunderstood.
sentences.chinese: 許多時候，我會發現這個屬性被誤用或誤解。

sentences.english: Finally, the misapplication of the model is indicated.
sentences.chinese: 最後指出模型的誤用與錯用問題。

sentences.english: Analyse case concrete use and easy to appear situation that misapply in using.
sentences.chinese: 分析案例的具體應用以及應用中容易出現誤用的情況。

sentences.english: So, the used rule of letter words need criteria.
sentences.chinese: 同時，在字母詞的使用上要注意濫用和誤用。

sentences.english: The manufacturers disclaim all responsibility for the damage caused by misuse .
sentences.chinese: 工廠主們放棄承擔因誤用造成的損失的責任。

sentences.english: In practice, the money may be wasted or misdirected.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，這些錢有可能浪費或者誤用。

sentences.english: There is a malapropism in his paper.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章裏有一處被誤用的詞。

sentences.english: If people misuse freedom, it is equally terrible.
sentences.chinese: 如果人們誤用自由，結果同樣可怕。

definition: touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
normally/as things should be/by rights/to reason things out/logic
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
endgame/conclusion/outcome/final part of a chess game
